Ingredients: 1 kg pork (cubed); 1/4 lb pig liver (cubed); 1 potato (diced); 1 carrot (cubed); 1 can tomato sauce (8 oz); 3 calamansi (or lime); 1 onion (minced); 5 cloves garlic (minced); 3 hotdogs (sliced); 4 bay leaves; 1 Knorr Pork Cube; soy sauce; sugar; salt; pepper; cooking oil
Instructions: Marinate pork with soy sauce and calamansi for 30 minutes. Sauté onion and garlic in oil. Add marinated pork and cook until browned. Add tomato sauce, water, Knorr Pork Cube, and simmer until pork is tender. Add liver, hotdogs, potato, and carrot, then cook for 8-10 minutes. Season with sugar, salt, and pepper.

Ingredients: 1 kg chicken or pork; 1 onion (sliced); 5 cloves garlic (minced); 1/4 cup soy sauce; 1/4 cup vinegar; 1 bay leaf; 1 tsp peppercorns; 1/2 cup water; 2 tbsp cooking oil; Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: Marinate meat with soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and bay leaf for at least 30 minutes. Sauté onion and garlic in oil, then add marinated meat. Add water, peppercorns, and simmer until meat is tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Ingredients: 1 kg beef (cubed); 1 onion (sliced); 1 potato (cubed); 1 carrot (cubed); 1 red bell pepper (sliced); 1 green bell pepper (sliced); 1 can tomato sauce; 1/2 cup liver spread; 1/2 cup green olives; 1/4 cup soy sauce; 2 bay leaves; Salt and pepper to taste; Cooking oil; Water
Instructions: Sauté onion and garlic in oil. Add beef and cook until browned. Add tomato sauce, liver spread, and soy sauce. Stir to combine. Add water, bay leaves, and simmer until beef is tender. Add olives, bell peppers, carrots, and potatoes. Continue cooking for 10-15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Add olives, bell peppers, carrots, and potatoes. Continue cooking for 10-15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Ingredients: 2 lbs. ruffle fat; 1 tablespoon whole peppercorn; 5 dried bay leaves; 2 ½ tablespoons sea salt; 4 cups canola oil; 6 cups water
Instructions: Arrange the ruffle fat, whole peppercorn, 2 tablespoons salt, and bay leaves in a cooking pot. Pour-in water. Let boil. Cover and then simmer for 1 hour. Turn the heat off. Remove the boiled ruffle fat from the pot and then let the water drip-off. Rub the remaining salt all over the ruffled fat. Set aside. Meanwhile, heat the cooking oil in a deep fryer or a deep cooking pot. When the oil gets hot, slowly add-in the ruffled fat. Deep fry in low to medium heat until the texture becomes crisp and the color turns medium brown. Remove from the deep fryer or cooking pot. Arrange in a plate lined with paper towels to absorb the oil. Serve with spiced vinegar. Share and enjoy!

Deep fry in low to medium heat until the texture becomes crisp and the color turns medium brown. Remove from the deep fryer or cooking pot. Arrange in a plate lined with paper towels to absorb the oil. Serve with spiced vinegar. Share and enjoy!

Ingredients: 1 kg chicken (cut into pieces); 1 potato (cubed); 1 carrot (cubed); 1 bell pepper (sliced); 1 can tomato sauce; 1/2 cup peas; 1 onion (sliced); 5 cloves garlic (minced); 1/4 cup soy sauce; Salt and pepper to taste; Cooking oil; Water
Instructions: Sauté onion and garlic in oil. Add chicken and cook until browned. Add tomato sauce, soy sauce, and water. Simmer until chicken is tender. Add potatoes, carrots, bell pepper, and peas. Continue cooking for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Ingredients: 1 lb pork belly (sliced into small pieces); 1/2 lb pork offal (like heart, liver, and intestines, optional, sliced into small pieces);2 cups fresh pork blood (or blood from butcher); 2 tbsp vinegar; 1 onion (minced); 5 cloves garlic (minced); 2-3 long green chili peppers (sliced); 1 tbsp ginger (minced); 2 tbsp fish sauce; 1/2 tsp salt (or to taste); 1/2 tsp pepper (or to taste); 1 cup water (or more if needed); 2 tbsp cooking oil
Instructions: In a large pot, heat the cooking oil over medium heat. Add the pork belly and offal (if using) and cook until browned and slightly crispy. Add the minced garlic, onion, and ginger to the pot. Sauté until fragrant and softened. Pour in the vinegar and let it simmer for about 2 minutes to cook off the raw taste of the vinegar. Pour in the pork blood and water. Stir gently to combine and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, allowing the blood to thicken and cook through. Add the fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Stir in the green chili peppers and continue to cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot, typically with steamed rice or paired with Filipino puto (rice cakes).

Ingredients: 1 lb pork belly (sliced into small pieces); 1/2 lb pork offal (like heart, liver, and intestines, optional, sliced into small pieces);2 cups fresh pork blood (or blood from butcher); 2 tbsp vinegar; 1 onion (minced); 5 cloves garlic (minced); 2-3 long green chili peppers (sliced); 1 tbsp ginger (minced); 2 tbsp fish sauce; 1/2 tsp salt (or to taste); 1/2 tsp pepper (or to taste); 1 cup water (or more if needed); 2 tbsp cooking oil

Pour in the pork blood and water. Stir gently to combine and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, allowing the blood to thicken and cook through. Add the fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Stir in the green chili peppers and continue to cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot, typically with steamed rice or paired with Filipino puto (rice cakes).

Ingredients: 1 lb pork belly (sliced into small pieces); 1/2 lb pork offal (like heart, liver, and intestines, optional, sliced into small pieces);2 cups fresh pork blood (or blood from butcher); 2 tbsp vinegar; 1 onion (minced); 5 cloves garlic (minced); 2-3 long green chili peppers (sliced); 1 tbsp ginger (minced); 2 tbsp fish sauce; 1/2 tsp salt (or to taste); 1/2 tsp pepper (or to taste); 1 cup water (or more if needed); 2 tbsp cooking oil
Instructions: In a large pot, heat the cooking oil over medium heat. Add the pork belly and offal (if using) and cook until browned and slightly crispy. Add the minced garlic, onion, and ginger to the pot. Sauté until fragrant and softened. Pour in the vinegar and let it simmer for about 2 minutes to cook off the raw taste of the vinegar. Pour in the pork blood and water. Stir gently to combine and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, allowing the blood to thicken and cook through. Add the fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Stir in the green chili peppers and continue to cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot, typically with steamed rice or paired with Filipino puto (rice cakes).

Ingredients: 1/4 cup sweetened red beans; 1/4 cup sweetened white beans; 4 cups shaved ice, from about 6 cups of ice cubes; 1 large banana, thinly sliced; 1/4 cup, drained jackfruit canned, sliced; 1/4 cup macapuno strips, drained; 1/4 cup nata de coco, drained; 1/4 cup red palm seeds (Kaong), drained; 1/4 cup green palm seeds (Kaong), drained; 1 cup evaporated milk, divided; 1/2 cup cap'n crunch with crunch berries cereal; 2 scoops ube ice cream, store-bought or homemade
Instructions: Gather the ingredients and two tall parfait glasses. Place half the sweetened red and white beans at the bottom of each glass. Process about half the ice cubes in an ice shaver, blender, or food processor until it looks like snow. Then scoop about a half cup of the shaved ice on top of the beans. Add some banana and jackfruit slices, and top with another half cup of shaved ice. Add the macapuno strips and nata de coco. Process the other half of the ice cubes and add another half cup of shaved ice on top. Add the red and green palm seeds. Then add the final half cup of shaved ice to each glass, doming it slightly on top. Pour 1/2 cup evaporated milk on top of each parfait and top with a scoop of ube ice cream. Don't forget to halo-halo it with a long spoon!

Instructions: Gather the ingredients and two tall parfait glasses. Place half the sweetened red and white beans at the bottom of each glass. Process about half the ice cubes in an ice shaver, blender, or food processor until it looks like snow. Then scoop about a half cup of the shaved ice on top of the beans. Add some banana and jackfruit slices, and top with another half cup of shaved ice. Add the macapuno strips and nata de coco. Process the other half of the ice cubes and add another half cup of shaved ice on top. Add the red and green palm seeds. Then add the final half cup of shaved ice to each glass, doming it slightly on top. Pour 1/2 cup evaporated milk on top of each parfait and top with a scoop of ube ice cream. Don't forget to halo-halo it with a long spoon!

Then add the final half cup of shaved ice to each glass, doming it slightly on top. Pour 1/2 cup evaporated milk on top of each parfait and top with a scoop of ube ice cream. Don't forget to halo-halo it with a long spoon!

Ingredients: 1 kg beef sirloin or brisket (cubed); 1 onion (sliced); 5 cloves garlic (minced); 1/4 cup soy sauce; 1/4 cup vinegar; 2 bay leaves; 1 cup tomato sauce; 1 potato (cubed); 1 carrot (cubed); 1/2 cup green olives; 1/4 cup cooking oil; Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: Marinate beef with soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and bay leaves for at least 30 minutes. Sauté onion and garlic in oil, then add marinated beef and cook until browned. Add tomato sauce, water, and simmer until beef is tender. Add potato, carrot, and olives. Continue cooking for another 10-15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Ingredients: 1 kg beef sirloin or brisket (cubed); 1 onion (sliced); 5 cloves garlic (minced); 1/4 cup soy sauce; 1/4 cup vinegar; 2 bay leaves; 1 cup tomato sauce; 1 potato (cubed); 1 carrot (cubed); 1/2 cup green olives; 1/4 cup cooking oil; Salt and pepper to taste

Ingredients: 1 lb pancit malabon noodles (thick rice noodles); 1/2 lb shrimp (peeled and deveined); 1/2 lb squid (cleaned and sliced into rings); 1/4 lb fish flakes (or tinapa flakes); 2 eggs (boiled and sliced); 1/4 cup shrimp paste (bagoong); 1 onion (minced); 4 cloves garlic (minced); 1/4 cup cooking oil; 1/4 cup fish sauce; 2 cups chicken broth; 1 tbsp annatto powder (for color) or annatto oil; 1/4 cup crushed peanuts; 2 tbsp soy sauce; 1/2 tsp ground black pepper; 1/2 tsp salt (to taste); 1-2 bay leaves; Calamansi (or lemon) wedges for serving; 2-3 stalks green onions (chopped); Banana leaves (optional, for garnish).
Instructions: Cook the pancit malabon noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. If using banana leaves, you can line the plate with the leaves for added aroma and presentation; In a separate pan, sauté the shrimp and squid in oil until they turn pink and are cooked through. Set aside; In a large pan, sauté garlic and onion in cooking oil until fragrant. Add shrimp paste (bagoong) and cook for a few minutes to release its flavors; Pour in the chicken broth and bring it to a simmer. Add the fish sauce, soy sauce, and annatto powder (or annatto oil) for color. Let it simmer for 5 minutes. Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper; Add the cooked noodles to the pan, tossing gently to coat the noodles with the sauce. Make sure the noodles are evenly coated; Once the noodles are well coated with the sauce, transfer them to a serving platter. Top with the cooked shrimp, squid, fish flakes, sliced boiled eggs, crushed peanuts, and green onions; Serve with calamansi (or lemon) wedges on the side for added tang and flavor.

Add the fish sauce, soy sauce, and annatto powder (or annatto oil) for color. Let it simmer for 5 minutes. Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper; Add the cooked noodles to the pan, tossing gently to coat the noodles with the sauce. Make sure the noodles are evenly coated; Once the noodles are well coated with the sauce, transfer them to a serving platter. Top with the cooked shrimp, squid, fish flakes, sliced boiled eggs, crushed peanuts, and green onions; Serve with calamansi (or lemon) wedges on the side for added tang and flavor.

Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper; Add the cooked noodles to the pan, tossing gently to coat the noodles with the sauce. Make sure the noodles are evenly coated; Once the noodles are well coated with the sauce, transfer them to a serving platter. Top with the cooked shrimp, squid, fish flakes, sliced boiled eggs, crushed peanuts, and green onions; Serve with calamansi (or lemon) wedges on the side for added tang and flavor.

Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper; Add the cooked noodles to the pan, tossing gently to coat the noodles with the sauce. Make sure the noodles are evenly coated; Once the noodles are well coated with the sauce, transfer them to a serving platter. Top with the cooked shrimp, squid, fish flakes, sliced boiled eggs, crushed peanuts, and green onions; Serve with calamansi (or lemon) wedges on the side for added tang and flavor.

Ingredients: 1 kg pork (cut into pieces); 1 onion (quartered); 2 tomatoes (quartered); 2-3 long green beans; 1 radish (sliced); 1 eggplant (sliced); 1 bunch kangkong (water spinach); 1 pack sinigang mix or tamarind paste; 1-2 green chili peppers; 1 tbsp fish sauce; Salt to taste; 1 liter water
Instructions: Boil pork in water until tender, skimming off scum as it rises. Add onion, tomatoes, and radish, then cook until soft. Add eggplant, green beans, and sinigang mix or tamarind paste, and simmer for another 5 minutes. Add fish sauce, green chili, and kangkong. Adjust seasoning with salt. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Ingredients: 1 kg pork (cut into pieces); 1 onion (quartered); 2 tomatoes (quartered); 2-3 long green beans; 1 radish (sliced); 1 eggplant (sliced); 1 bunch kangkong (water spinach); 1 pack sinigang mix or tamarind paste; 1-2 green chili peppers; 1 tbsp fish sauce; Salt to taste; 1 liter water

Ingredients: 1 kg pork belly; 1/4 lb pig ears; 1/4 lb chicken liver; 1 onion (minced); 3 cloves garlic (minced); 1/4 cup mayonnaise; 2 tbsp soy sauce; 2 tbsp calamansi (or lemon juice); 1 tbsp chili peppers (minced); 1/2 tsp pepper; Salt to taste; 1 egg (optional); Cooking oil
Instructions: Boil pork belly, pig ears, and chicken liver until tender. Drain and chop into small pieces. Sauté onion and garlic in oil until fragrant. Add the chopped pork, pig ears, and liver. Add soy sauce, chili peppers, calamansi juice, pepper, and salt. Mix well. Top with mayonnaise and stir to combine. If desired, add an egg on top and cook until set. Serve hot, typically on a sizzling plate.

Ingredients: 1 pack Pancit_Canton wrappers; 1 lb ground pork; 1/2 cup carrots (julienned); 1/2 cup green beans (sliced thinly); 1/4 cup onions (chopped); 2 cloves garlic (minced); 1 egg; 1 tbsp soy sauce; Salt and pepper to taste; Cooking oil for frying
Instructions: Mix ground pork, carrots, green beans, onions, garlic, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Place a spoonful of the mixture in a Pancit_Canton wrapper and roll tightly, sealing the edges with a beaten egg. Heat oil in a pan and fry the Pancit_Canton until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and serve with sweet and sour dipping sauce.

Place a spoonful of the mixture in a Pancit_Canton wrapper and roll tightly, sealing the edges with a beaten egg. Heat oil in a pan and fry the Pancit_Canton until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and serve with sweet and sour dipping sauce.

Ingredients: 1 kg oxtail (or pork hock); 1/2 lb tripe; 1 bunch string beans; 1 eggplant (sliced); 1/2 banana blossom (optional); 1/4 cup peanut butter; 1/4 cup ground peanuts; 1/2 cup annatto oil (for color); 1 onion (sliced); 4 cloves garlic (minced); 1 tbsp shrimp paste (bagoong); Salt to taste; Water
Instructions: Boil oxtail and tripe until tender. Sauté onion and garlic in annatto oil until fragrant. Add the boiled oxtail and tripe to the sautéed mixture. Add peanut butter, ground peanuts, and water, then bring to a boil. Add string beans, eggplant, and banana blossom. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. Season with salt and serve with shrimp paste (bagoong) on the side.

Add peanut butter, ground peanuts, and water, then bring to a boil. Add string beans, eggplant, and banana blossom. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. Season with salt and serve with shrimp paste (bagoong) on the side.

Ingredients: 1 whole pig (about 20-25 lbs); 1/4 cup soy sauce; 1/4 cup salt; 1 tbsp black pepper; 5 cloves garlic (minced); 2 tbsp vinegar; 1 onion (quartered); 1 bunch lemongrass (bruised); Banana leaves; Cooking oil
Instructions: Clean the pig and season with soy sauce, salt, pepper, garlic, and vinegar. Stuff with onion and lemongrass. Wrap the pig in banana leaves and secure it with twine. Roast the pig over a charcoal pit for several hours, turning occasionally until skin is crispy. Baste with cooking oil as it cooks for a golden finish.

Roast the pig over a charcoal pit for several hours, turning occasionally until skin is crispy. Baste with cooking oil as it cooks for a golden finish.

Ingredients: 1 pack Pancit_Canton wrappers; 1 lb ground pork; 1/2 cup carrots (julienned); 1/2 cup green beans (sliced thinly); 1/4 cup onions (chopped); 2 cloves garlic (minced); 1 egg; 1 tbsp soy sauce; Salt and pepper to taste; Cooking oil for frying
Instructions: Mix ground pork, carrots, green beans, onions, garlic, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Place a spoonful of the mixture in a Pancit_Canton wrapper and roll tightly, sealing the edges with a beaten egg. Heat oil in a pan and fry the Pancit_Canton until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and serve with sweet and sour dipping sauce.
